abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Mortgage Finance
            Technical Assistance Project of Algeria were as follows:
            outcomes were moderately satisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was low or negligible, the Bank
            performance was satisfactory, and the Borrower performance
            was satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: The lack of
            responsiveness from the Ministry of Housing slowed
            considerably the project implementation. The
            inter-ministerial steering committee put in place to ensure
            participation and cooperation between the different
            ministries was only adopted at the end of the project and
            therefore did not have the intended catalyzing effect
            intended. The important lesson here is that during the risk
            evaluation of a project, the team should also anticipate the
            possible break-down of the mitigating measure and revise
            them in order to make them as full-proof as possible. The
            quantitative data required for the impact evaluation of the
            project was extremely difficult to obtain. As a result, the
            impact evaluation can only be qualitative, therefore at
            times subjective. It is important for project teams to
            remember that while controlling spending is very important,
            it is equally important to respond to the needs of the
            borrower and provide know-how and assistance where and when
            required. Finally, project teams should keep in mind that if
            all the blocks are important in the building of a structure,
            the sequence in which they are laid is also vital to ensure
            the soundness of the construction.
